FSG: 已經完成組軍

Naby Keita insists he is ignoring speculation linking the RB Leipzig star with a move to Liverpool this summer.

The Guiena midfielder was a key member of the Leipzig side in the 2016-17 season as the Bundesliga outfit finished behind Bayern Munich in the title race.

RB Leipzig have booked their place in the Champions League group-stage draw, while Jurgen Klopp’s side must still get through a qualifying round at the start og the season.

Keita scored eight times and made seven assists in 31 appearances for the Bundesliga club in the 2016-17 campaign to prompt talk of a club-record £50m move to Anfield this summer.

Gael Clichy is NOT on his way to Liverpool

Right, time to cross another one off the list.

Despite reports in certain quarters this morning, Gael Clichy is NOT on his way to Liverpool on a two-year deal.

The ECHO understands he is not a target for Jurgen Klopp, who is still keen to add a new left-back this summer.

Liverpool’s search for a left-back started with Ryan Sessegnon, but reports claimed that the Reds have moved on to other targets with Tottenham leading the race for the Fulham wonderkid.

Benjamin Mendy was linked yesterday, but he is likely to move to Man City or Chelsea.

車成日放走好野唔奇, 不過條友係荷甲都唔係超班都唔駛太大期望, 就咁睇都啱高普踢, 有D身高, 有D腳法都算靈活, 都係奧力子個類.


佢踢荷甲個時得17歲定18歲。
我認為球迷們對佢要求未免太苛刻。

而你地所講既奧力子當年法甲直頭入選法國最垃圾陣容。但今時今日雖然講唔上勁，但又廢唔晒都show到少少作用。

講緊奧力子係好似1000幾萬鎊，而solanke只係3m貨仔，又當英人，我唔明點解有人會感到悲觀

【售票資料原文】

全城關注的英超亞洲挑戰盃7月19及22日會於香港上演，4支英超勁旅包括利物浦、李斯特城、水晶宮及西布朗將東來獻技，賽會6月1日（周四）就會透過記招公布賽事及售票詳情。對於球迷對關心的公開售票日期，足總主席梁孔德及行政總裁薛基輔周三（5月31日）出席發布會時，先後透露有關賽事的資訊，其中梁孔德指：「門票會在周五（6月2日）開始，透過購票通發售。」薛基輔則稱，預計4支來港球隊，大部份均會如2013年般入住君悅酒店，唯獨利物浦似乎希望另覓落腳地。

Peter Moore will begin his new role as CEO of Liverpool Football Club from today. He will report directly to FSG.

Moore: "Jurgen is for me the pre-eminent manager in the world now. Every club would love to have Jurgen Klopp in charge of their club."

Moore: "What we need to do to continue to provide Jurgen and Michael with the resources, that's our remit, that's the key."

Liverpool will not be panicked into changing their transfer strategy to try to keep up with Manchester City, says new CEO Peter Moore.

Moore on City: “It’s not about saying, ‘They spent a dollar, so we’ll spend a dollar' - It’s not, ‘They’ve spent £100m so we spend £100m."

Moore: "It’s about we strengthen our squad in these positions and it has cost us this. I may be naive but I’m not looking at my competitor."

Moore: "Let’s call City a competitor - spending this, therefore I need to spend that regardless of the quality of the players."

Moore: "That makes no business sense to me. The theory that because Man City spends £100 million, we need to spend £100 million?"

Moore on City: "If your neighbour puts £50,000 into his greenhouse, will you spend £50,000 on a greenhouse to keep up with your comparable?"

Moore: "No. You do what makes good sense for your house. I can’t think of a better analogy than the greenhouse."

Peter Moore: "Everyone wants to see massive money but my business background is buying talent at the right price."

Peter Moore: "We have a kid called Philippe Coutinho who cost £8m, and he is as good as other guys who cost four or five times as much."

Moore: "What I am about, and what I believe this club is about, is making good business decisions."

Moore: "I think the stars are aligned here at the moment. We have good owners, amazing investment in the stadium, & a world class manager."

Moore: "We have money to spend on the team and we will be ready for our Champions League qualifying games."

Moore: "We are presently laying down a brand new multi-million pound players surface, planning to improve our training facilities."

Peter Moore will begin his new role as chief executive officer of Liverpool Football Club from today.

Liverpool-born Moore, a passionate Reds fan, joins the club from Electronic Arts where he held the position of chief competition officer as well as a number of leadership positions in his decade with the gaming industry giant.

"I am not only incredibly proud to be joining a club that I have held very close to my heart my whole life, but also extremely determined to give everything I have to bring success to Anfield," he told Liverpoolfc.com.

"To be charged with the task of leading this incredible institution is a huge honour and I hope to be able to build upon the successes of my predecessor and use my experience and passion to do great things here.

"It's wonderful to be back home in Liverpool and embarking on a unique journey like this. I hope I can do our club and our fans proud."
